Description.p: The academic attainment goals of the student when they enrolment, e.g. they wish to achieve a certain qualification.
Reference to StudentVoice entry recording the Student's academic attainment goals at the time of enrolment.

A list of the academic days in the order they are used in the rotation of this schedule. If a particular academic day appears more than once in the rotation, then it will appear more than once in this list. eg. A 5 day rotation with days A, A, B, A, A, would have 5 entries in the list.
An academic day that is part of this schedule.
An academic day that is part of this schedule.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
The period times within the schedule this academic day is following.
A list of the periods that make up this academic day, e.g. Period 1, Period 2 etc.
A list of the student's academic goals.
Information about a student's career goal.
Information about a student's academic goal.
The date the student's goal was recorded.
The date the student achieved their goal.
A description of the goal the student wants to achieve.
The name of the goal the student wants to achieve.
The subject area the student's academic goal is for.
A list of the providers and staff who have been sent the alerts and have acknowledged they have been read.
A provider or staff member that has been sent the alerts and have acknowledged they have been read.
A provider or staff member that has been sent the alerts and have acknowledged they have been read.
A staff member who has been sent the alerts and have acknowledged they have been read.
A provider who has been sent the alerts and have acknowledged they have been read.
Indicates whether or not a staff member has viewed the alerts.
The date the provider acknowledged a staff member has viewed the alerts.
A list of the actions taken as a result of this Wellbeing event.
The action taken as a result of this Wellbeing event.
Defines details about an ad hoc meeting. When ad hoc meeting details are provided scheduled meeting details cannot be provided.
The name of the ad hoc meeting.
The time the ad hoc meeting started.
The time the ad hoc meeting finished.
This element contains address data.
Code defining the class of the address: Urban, Rural, Delivery Service or Foreign.
Address line 1.
Address line 2.
Address line 3.
Address line 4.
The suburb part of urban addresses, or the 'RD No' part of rural addresses
The city part of the address.
The region, state or province code. StateTerritory Code only applicable if a non-New Zealand Address.
The ZIP/postal code.
The country code.

The latitude and longitude of the location implied by the address. Grid location values are derived from New Zealand Map Grid x,y coordinates and converted to Latitude and Longitude values per the World Geodetic System 1984 (G1762).
A list of statistical areas containing the location implied by the Address
A set of Addresses for a person (StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal or StudentContactPersonal) or Organisation
The person or organisation's physical address.
The person or organisation's postal address.
A list of scores for the assessment task result.
An Assessment Result Score that is a member of the related AssessmentResultScoreList.
The score metric and value for an assessment task result.

Either defines that the score is an over-arching final aggregate score derived from a collection of other scores, or the fact that the score is derived from a multi-stage marking and moderation process, e.g. inital, interim, moderated and final scores for a single assessment.

Competency provides a link to one or more line-items in a machine readable curriculum, and says this particular score applies to one of the “competencies” listed in the curriculum, e.g. NZ Curriculum for English under “Listening, Reading & Viewing” has the following “skills”
  • Processes and Strategies
  • Ideas
  • Language Features
  • Structure
Whereas NZ Curriculum for Mathematics has the following “skills”
  • Number Strategies
  • Number Knowledge
  • Equations and Expressions
  • Patterns and Relationships
When certain assessments have individual “skills” or “competencies” assessed, then individual scoreResults will have pointers to the relevant curriculum line-item.
Code denoting the score metric type of the assessment task result.

The score the student received for assessment task against that metric. If the result score is for an NZQA or International Baccalaureate then the ScoreResultCode using the enumeration NZCodeSetsAssessmentResultType must be used instead.
The maximum value possible for the score.

The Item within an NZQA Assessment Task that the score is for. When a marker marks an external assessment (a paper for a standard in an examination, for example) they provide a score of 0-8 for each item (question) in the paper.
Typically a paper will have 3 items for a total score of 24. However there can be more items than this.
The individual item scores, and the total are then sent back to NZQA’s eQA system from the marking application.
A list of AssessmentTasks that are related to other AssessmentTasks (e.g. as prerequisites), ProviderCourses (denoting assessments required to pass the course), etc.
A sub assessment task.
Breakdown of times that the student was recorded as being present or absent from school or class.
Details of a specfic time at which the student was recorded as being present or absent from school or class.
Time span that the student entered or returned to school
The scheduled period this attendnance time list record is for. The SchedulePeriod must be provided if the AttendanceType = 'Scheduled'.
The teaching group that this attendance reord is for, i.e. the class the student was in when the attendance was recorded.

The type of attendance being recorded e.g. Scheduled or Ad Hoc. If it is a schedule attendance then the SchedulePeriod must also be provided. If it is an Ad Hoc attendance then StartDateTime and EndDateTime must also be provided.
The attendance code group the students attendance code belongs to.
The globally unique identifier for the student's particular attendance reord.
The source system identifier of the student's particular attendance reord.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
MoE defined code for attendance or absence during the time period described.
The date the attendance is being record for.
The End Time of the students attendance for the provided Attendance Date. Mandatory for attendance records with a type of 'Ad Hoc'.
Free text note about the students attendance for the provided date and time/period.
The Start Time of the students attendance for the provided Attendance Date. Mandatory for attendance records with a type of 'Ad Hoc'.
The date the students attendance for this date and time/period was submitted.
A person that attended the debriefing.
Container for details of an Award, where this response was in relation to a particular Award.
Date when to be awarded.
The type of award that was achieved.
Description of the Award.
Any comments/notes associated with the Award.
A set of attributes common to multiple kinds of communication channel
Notes on when / how to use the communication channel. eg: Phone after 4pm. Schools may also use this note to record caregiver related contact details, eg “Mon to Wed only”.
Preference number indicating an order in which communication channels should be used when contacting person or organisation.
A code describing the acceptable usage of a person or organisation's communication channel
Base type, without attributes, for Name elements, primarily to allow structure to be leveraged with different Type attribute values.

A title or prefix associated with the name. If any of: Mr, Mrs, Ms, Miss, Rev, Fr, Dr, Prof, Hon, Sir, Lord, Lady - these must be as shown, otherwise free text. Note that title is not applicable to learners.

Family name. That part of the person's name which is used to describe family, clan, tribal group, or marital association. Note that this element is required when known. However, it may not be possible to know the family name in which case you should add the available information to the FullName element.

Given name of the person. Note that this element is required if known. However, it may not be possible to know the given name in which case you should add the available information to the FullName element.

Middle names can be sent altogether in one element or if the source system has more than one middle name field across two elements. MiddleName with either contain all other given or middle names, each separated with a single space character, or it will hold the person's first middle name and SecondMiddleName will hold the other.

Middle names can be sent altogether in one element or if the source system has more than one middle name field, they can be spread across two elements. SecondMiddleName will either contain no values, or it will hold the person's second and subsequent middle names while MiddleName will hold the person's first middle name.
An indicator used to identify the naming conventions used by some predominantly non-European, ethnic or language groups and related to the display nature of a name.
The family name preferred most by the person (as written).
An indicator used to identify the naming conventions used by some predominantly non-European, ethnic or language groups and related to the display nature of a name.
The given name preferred most by the person (as written).
Textual suffix like PHD, JP, BSc.

A free text field for the complete name for display purposes. If this is associated with a StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal or StudentContactPersonal record and the FamilyName and GivenName are not both specified, then this becomes mandatory.
Code denoting how the name provided is used, e.g. birth name, preferred name, also known as (alias) etc.
Flag denoting that this name has been verified. Note: actual verification details are held in NameVerification sub-object.
The personal information common to all classes of person, StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal and Student ContactPersonal.
The name of the person.
The person's e-mail address(es).
Information common to all flavours of Student's Goals.
The date the student's goal was recorded.
The date the student achieved their goal.
A description of the goal the student wants to achieve.
The name of the goal the student wants to achieve.
The list of the people and/or property that the student, who was restrained, was directing their behaviour at.
The person and/or piece of property that the student, who was restrained, was directing their behaviour at.
The person and/or piece of property that the student, who was restrained, was directing their behaviour at.
The person the student's behaviour was directed at.
Free text describing the behaviour the student showed towards a person of piece of property.
Code set denoting type of object or person the student was directing their behaviour at, e.g. Staff Member, Student, Desk, Chair.
A list of the problem behaviours identified for the student as a result of the Wellbeing Event.

A problem behaviour identified for the student as a result of the Wellbeing Event. The severity of a behaviour may be minor or major. If it is minor only values from NZCodeSetsWellbeingEventMinorBehaviour are applicable. If it is majoronly values from NZCodeSetsWellbeingEventMajorBehaviour are applicable.

A problem behaviour identified for the student as a result of the Wellbeing Event. The severity of a behaviour may be minor or major. If it is minor only values from NZCodeSetsWellbeingEventMinorBehaviour are applicable. If it is majoronly values from NZCodeSetsWellbeingEventMajorBehaviour are applicable.
The type of minor problem behaviour identified as a result of the Wellbeing Event.
The type of major problem behaviour identified as a reult of a Wellbeing Event.
The severity of the Wellbeing Event.
A list of calendar dates and the period times, academic day and terms that applies to each day within the schedule.
A calendar date and the period time, academic day and terms that applies to it.
A calendar date and the period time, academic day and terms that applies to it.
The actual date the school is in session.
Flag indicating that the School was closed on the indicated date.
The academic day that is taking place on this calendar date.
The schedule times of the periods occuring on this calendar date.
A list of the schedule terms that are relevant to this calendar date.
A list of the student's career goals.
Information about a student's career goal.
A record of the Student's progress in a set of learning strands from the Technology curriculum, that were covered in the class.
A record of the Student's progress in a particular learning strand from the Technology curriculum, that was covered in the class.
A record of the Student's progress in a particular learning strand from the Technology curriculum, that was covered in the class.
Code denoting the particular learning strand from the Technology curriculum, that was covered in the class, and for which the student's progress is being reported.
A record of the Student's progress in a set of achievement objectives from the from the Technology curriculum strand, that was covered in the class.
A particular person or organisation's communications method
Notes on when / how to use the communication channel. eg: Phone after 4pm. Schools may also use this note to record caregiver related contact details, eg “Mon to Wed only”.
Preference number indicating an order in which communication channels should be used when contacting person or organisation.
A code describing the acceptable usage of a person or organisation's communication channel
The unique value that provides access to the channel. eg: URL for a website; Facebook page address, Twitter handle.
A set of people/organisation's communications channels
An organisation's website address.

Contains Yes/No characteristics of the contact person's role. Provide a Yes value for all that apply. At least one of the child elements of ContactFlags must have a Yes value. Do not publish the StudentContactRelationship instance if one of the child elements does not have a Yes value.
Does the individual have parental or legal guardianship responsibility for the student?
Does the student live with this contact?
Does this contact have access to the student's records?
In particular, should this contact receive a copy of the student report?
Should this contact be notified in case of emergency?
Should this contact be notified in case of a civil defence emergency?
Should this contact be notified in case of a civil defence emergency where the normal emergency contact is not close to a hosting school?
Is this person to be contacted in case of disciplinary action?
Should this contact be notified in case of an attendance issue?
Does this person provide daily living or personal assistance to the student?
Is this the contact responsible for Payment of Fees?
Does this contact have access to fees information?
Does this person receive family mail?
Is there a Protection Order, Restraining Order or some other court order against this person?
A list of people's contact details
Information for a contact person at an education provider or other organisation.
The contact's name
The title the contact has within the Organisation being contacted
The role the contact plays within the Organisation being contacted
List of Email elements.
List of PhoneNumber elements.
A list of a countries.
A country identified by its ISO 3166 code.
A list of associated courses.
An associated course.
A list of credentials that the learning standard contributes to attaining.
A credential that the learning standard or provider course contributes to attaining.
A list of the periods that make up the period time schedule and their start and end times.
A period that makes up or partially makes up the period time schedule and its start and end times.
A period that makes up or partially makes up the period time schedule and its start and end times.
A period that makes up or partially makes up the period time schedule.
The time the period starts.
The time the period ends.
Demographics information about the student, contact, staff member, etc.
The person's date of death.
The person's place of birth - like village, town, city etc.
The person's country of birth.
A person's country(s) of citizenship.
The citizenship or residency status of the person.
The verification event that verified the residency status of the person. Absence of a verification event indicates that the residency was not verified against an identity document.
The gender with which the person identifies.
List of languages an individual uses to communicate.
Date the person first arrived in the country.
One or more ethnic groups with which the person identifies.
A list of one or more iwi with which the person has an affiliation.
Container for details of a Detention.
Categorisation of a Detention.
The date of the detention.
Eventually to be typed for initial draft will be string to try and determine a valid code set.
Any notes that can be provided regarding the need/response that led to the detention.
List which describes the meta-data for, and the Location of any associated documents.
The RefId of the associated documents.
The list of the types of early childhood education the parent told a primary school that the student received and the hours per week and/or day the student attended.
The type of early childhood education the student received and the hours per week and/or day the student attended.
History of a type of early childhood education the student received and the hours per week and/or day the student attended.
The type of early childhood education the student received.
The number of hours per day the student attended this ECE Type. A string value conforming to regular expression for numeric range 0-24hours (with max 2 decimal places)
The number of hours per week the student attended this ECE Type. A string value conforming to regular expression for numeric range 0-168 hours (with max 2 decimal places)
Describes the properties of the early childhood education service offered by the Provider.
The primary language utilised by the ECE Service.
Code denoting the type ECE Service, eg. Kindergarten, Playcentre, Kohanga Reo, etc.
Additional information about a language when one of the 'Other' language codes sets is selected.
The type of early childhood education the student received before enrolling in their first school.
The type of early childhood education the student received.
The number of hours the student attended early childhood education for.
Generic organisation that operates within the education sector. For example Providers, Communities of Learning, Ministry local offices, etc.
The name of the School Management System (SMS) that the provider is currently using. Note: not all education providers use an SMS.
Provides iinformation specific to Te Rito, e.g. which functionality in Te Rito an organisation (school, ECE etc.) is utilising.
The set of postal and other addresses that the Organisation uses
A method of communication with the organisation.
A list of one or more cotact persons related to the organisation
A region of New Zealand defined by the Ministry of Education for administrative purposes
The special education district the provider belongs to.
The set of contact email addresses that the Organisation uses
The opening date of the Organisation. For proposed or approved organisations this will be the projected opening date.
Closing date of the Organisation. Only present for closed providers
The normal business name of the Organisation
The set of contact phone numbers that the Organisation uses
A list of other organisations that are related to the Provider
Current status of the Provider
The reason the operational status of the organisation was changed.
Describes the nature of the Organisation; for Schools this indicate the schooling levels offered.
Code denoting the role the organisation plays within the education sector, e.g. School Sector Institution, Learning Support Cluster, etc.
A code denoting the authority by which the Provider is authorised to provide education services.
Indicates whether or not an ECE Service Provider Organisation is a Licenced ECE Service Provider.
Indicates whether or not an ECE Service Provider Organisation is a Playgroup Service Provider.
The type of ECE Service Provider ownership, e.g. Sole Trader, Company, Charitable Trust etc.
Only present if the Provider is a provider of school education services. Contains properties that are school-specific.
Only present if the Provider is a provider of early childhood education (ECE) services. Contains properties that are early learning specific.
Only present if the Provider is a provider of tertiary education services. Contains properties that are tertiary education specific.
This element represents an e-mail address of one of a number of types and occurs in objects such as StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal, StudentContactPersonal, etc.
Generic object reference to the organisation that provided the email address.
Notes on when / how to use the communication channel. eg: Phone after 4pm. Schools may also use this note to record caregiver related contact details, eg “Mon to Wed only”.
Preference number indicating an order in which communication channels should be used when contacting person or organisation.
A code describing the acceptable usage of a person or organisation's communication channel
The actual email address.
A list of EnactedPolicy elements, describing the state legislated policy choices the school has adopted, and the time-period of that adoption.
A descriptor for a particular enacted policy that has been adopted by a school.
The date from which the school adopted the policy. If not populated then this is the current/original policy of the school.
The date after which the school has no longer adopted the policy. If not populated then the school has no planned date to end the policy.
Which recognised policy has been chosen?
An end date, which includes an implied 23:59:59.999 if it was expressed as a date-time
A list of one or more ethnic groups with which a person identifies.
An ethnic group with which the person identifies, and if there is more than one, their order of preference.
An ethnic group with which the person identifies, and if there is more than one, their order of preference.
An ethnic group with which the person identifies.
The order of preference for the person's ethnicity. '1' is their first preference. If left NULL means no preference is set and defers to any ethnicity with a preference of '1'.
A list of the locations where the incident took place.
The location where the incident took place.
Full time equivalent numeric value of the student's course load during this attendance period, expressed in decimal form, where 1.00 represents a full time enrollment.
This element contains a map location. The GridLocation element is utilized within the Address element.
Degress north or south of the equator
Degrees east or west of Grenwhich Meridian
A list of one or more affiliations of a person with a Hapū within an Iwi.
A Hapū a person is affiliated with.
A Hapū a person is affiliated with.
The name of a Hapū that the person is affiliated with.

Indicates the persons preferred Hapu. The order of preference for the person's Hapu. '1' is their first preference. If left NULL means no preference is set and defers to any Hapu with a preference of '1'.
Details of a healthcare service provided by the student contact, for example if the contact is a doctor or dentist.
List of Households this Person is associated with
Conact information for a household
Common element used to supply information about a particular household a person is a member of.
Priority of Household Contact in relation to this Person.
Local identifier for the household
Salutation to be used in addressing this household.
A list of addresses for the household.
List of Email elements.
List of PhoneNumber elements.
A list of households associated with the relationship.
Repeatable element containing the Id of a household that the Student and StudentContact are members of.
Additional information collected for international school enrolments
The date upon which the student arrived in New Zealand; not necessarily their first date of NZ schooling.
The amount in NZ$ excluding GST, that the student is paying per-week, for tuition as an international student.
The type of exchange scheme for student enrolment where the Eligibility Criteria is "Student on Government approved exchange scheme" (60005).
A list of references to Wellbeing Event, Response & Appeal data objects, that record the process of terminating a students enrolment.
A reference to a Wellbeing Event, Response & Appeal data object, that records the process of terminating a students enrolment.
A list of one or more affiliations of a person with an iwi.
An iwi the person is associated to.
An iwi the person is affiliated to.
The code of the iwi the person is affiliated to.

Indicates the persons preferred Iwi. The order of preference for the person's Iwi. '1' is their first preference. If left NULL means no preference is set and defers to any Iwi with a preference of '1'.
A list of one or more affiliations of a person with a Hapū within an Iwi.
A list identifying the assessment task results that justify the student achieving this attainment.
An assessment task result that justifies the student achieving this attainment.
<font color="#3c3c3c">A generic reference to an assessment task result or other student attainment that justifies the student achieving this attainment.</font>
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
The type of the referenced object:
Code recording how the justifying assessment task or provider course was assessed.
The final result the Student achieved on the justifying assessment task or provider course.
The date the Student achieved the justifying assessment task or provider course.
The number of credits towards this Attainment that were accrued by the justifying assessment task or provider course.
A list of key contacts for the alert.
A key contact for the Wellbeing Alert and their role, e.g. Parent, Doctor, Principal.
A key contact for the Wellbeing Alert and their role, e.g. Parent, Doctor, Principal.
The role of the key contact in relation to the Wellbeing Alert.
Details about the contact, e.g. Doctor, Parent, Principal.
A language that an individual uses to communicate.
The code representing the specific language that an individual uses to communicate
The usage of the language by a person, potentially indicating capability and preference for the language.
Specific dialect of a person's language.
A list of the person's proficiency in the language in regards to speaking, reading and writing.
A list of languages that an individual uses to communicate.
A language that an individual uses to communicate.
Records the number of hours per week the Learner is taught in each language.
The number of hours per week the Learner is taught in a specific language during the enrolment.
Code denoting the actual language of instruction.
The level of instruction that is made in the selected language.
A list of the person's proficiency in the language in regards to speaking, reading and writing.
The person's proficiency in the language in regards to speaking, reading and writing.
The person's proficiency in the language in regards to speaking, reading and writing.
The person's proficency level in the language in regards to reading, writing or speaking.
The type of language proficency, e.g. speaking, writing or reading.
A list of ObjectReferences providing a manner of referring to a collection of LearningStandards.
A repeatable element referencing the LearningStandard.
This is a common element used to define the locally assigned identifier associated with an entity.
A list of Location elements.
A list of Location elements.
This element contains data about a geographical location.
A description for the Location.
Number identifying the individual location within the set of locations used by the Provider.
The physical address of the Location.

The latitude and longitude of the location. Grid location values are derived from New Zealand Map Grid x,y coordinates and converted to Latitude and Longitude values per the World Geodetic System 1984 (G1762).
A list of Statistical Areas containing the location.
A list of a persons known medical needs.
A persons known medical need.
A list consents that have been provided for administration of a medicine to a student.
Contains information about when, by whom, and who consent was given to for the administration of a medicine to a student.
Contains information about when, by whom, and who consent was given to for the administration of a medicine to a student.
The date from which the student or student caretaker consented to the medicine being administered to the student by a particular individual.
The date the consent for administration of the medicine ends or is revoked.
The student or student caregiver that has consented to the medicine being administered to the student by the school.
The provider the medication administartion consent is applicable to.
The staff member at the school that have been given permission by the student or the student's caregiver to administer the medicine to the student.
A list of the medications required for this Wellbeing Characteristic.
The medication, dosage and frequency, required by the student to manage the Wellbeing Characteristic.
The medication, dosage and frequency, required by the student to manage the Wellbeing Characteristic.
Name of medication required for the student.
Dosage and strength of medication required for the student.
Frequency of Administration.
Information about how the medication is to be administered.
Method of administration.
A list consents that have been provided for administration of a medicine to a student.
1 to 10 digit National Student Number, potentially with leading zeros, as a string because it's too big for int32
NZQA specific registration details. Used for registrations made to NZQA only.
The student's NZQA enrolment Id.
The student's NZQA entry Id provided upon confirmation of the student's registration to be assessed against a unit or achievement standard.
Denotes whether the request to NZQA is for a Digital Exam/ Paper Exam or Digital Submission / Physical Submission.
The language requested for a translated exam paper, e.g. Te Reo Māori.
The language the student will submit their work in, e.g. Te Reo Māori.
NZQA details for a student for this school year.
The student's NZQA enrolment Id.
The exam centre the student is sitting their NZQA assessments though.
Amount paid by student to school for current year's NZQA fees.
Code set denoting the type of financial assistance the student is receiving.
Student’s NZQA sort code, e.g. 13AB. Sort order for admission slips. Often the form class of the student.
Full name of person submitting student information to NZQA.
E-mail address of person submitting student information to NZQA.
Indicates that the student has withdrawn from all NZQA assessments.

A reference to another named SIF Data Object; contains the name of the SIF object being referenced, so that the reference may refer to different object types. Eg: StudentAttainment has an attainment object reference which can refer to any one of ProviderCourse, Credential or LearningStandard.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
The type of the referenced object:
A list of notes that have been written about the associated subject matter.
A free text note about the associated subject matter.
A free text note about the associated subject matter.
Free text note.
The date and time the note was created.
The date and time the note was last updated.
Generic reference to the user that created the note.
Generic reference to the user that last updated the note.

A reference to another SIF Data Object; normally contains just the refId of the object, but may also contain one or more of:
  • ObjectType
  • LocalId
  • Name
Can be used to refer to different object types. Eg: StudentAttainment has an attainment object reference which can refer to any one of ProviderCourse, Credential or LearningStandard.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
A list of official diagnoses that pertains to this wellbeing characteristic.
An official diagnosis that pertains to this wellbeing characteristic.
An official diagnosis that pertains to this Wellbeing Characteristic.
The official diagnosis type the student was given.
The official diagnosis sub-type the student was given.

Providers additional free text information about an official diagnosis. Mandatory when the Official Diagnosis Type selected is ‘Physical Impairments’, or ‘Medical Conditions’. Mandatory when the Official Diagnosis Sub-Type selected is ‘Other neurodevelopmental disorders/developmental anomalies’, Other mental health disorders’, or ‘Other sensory impairment’.
A list of documents that conatin information that pertain to this official diagnosis.
A list of e-mail addresses for an Organisation
An organisation's main email address.
A list of the education providers and organisations involved, and their role, e.g. assessing provider, assessment provider, assessment location provider.
The education provider or organisaiton involved with the assessment task and the role they play, e.g. assessing provider, assessment location provider, assessment provider, registering organisation.
The education provider or organisation involved with the assessment task and the role they play, e.g. assessing provider, assessment location provider, assessment provider, registering organisation.
The system defind UUID of the Organisation being referenced
The Ministry of Education Organisation Id of the Organisation being referenced
The normal descriptive name of the referenced organisation.
A reference to a Provider specific location at the Organisation; rather than the Provider as a whole.
The role of the education provider or organisation in relation to the assessment task, e.g. assessing provider, assessment location provider, assessment provider, registering provider.
A reference to an Organisation data object.
The system defind UUID of the Organisation being referenced
The Ministry of Education Organisation Id of the Organisation being referenced
The normal descriptive name of the referenced organisation.
A reference to a Provider specific location at the Organisation; rather than the Provider as a whole.
Lists phone numbers associated with an Organisation
An organisation's main contact number.
Previous, alternate or other names or aliases associated with a person.
Name of the person.
Container for details of any other response that cannot be classified by previous types.
Date of the other response
Description of the other response.
Any comments/notes associated with the other response.
A list of the periods that make up this academic day, e.g. Period 1, Period 2 etc.
A period that makes up part or all of this academic day, e.g. Period 1, Period 2 etc.
A student associated to a document and their role in relation to it, e.g. author, owner, reviewer, subject of.
A non student person associated to a document and their role in relation to it, e.g. author, owner, reviewer, subject of.
The list of people associated to a document and their role in relation to it, e.g. author, owner, reviewer, subject of.
The owner of the document
The author of the document.
The subject of the document.
The reviewer of the document.
The person who add the object.
A list of e-mail addresses for a person (StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal or StudentContactPersonal)
A person's personal email address.
A person's work email address.
List of People involved in the Wellbeing Event/Response. Mandatory if more people than the student to which this event/response occurs is involved.
A repeatable element recording the identifier and details of another person that was involved in the Wellbeing Event/Response.
A person (additional to the student) involved in a Wellbeing Event/Response where required to be known.

The current year level of the student, at the time the associated record was created. Valid values are 0 to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
Optional free text detailing level of involvement.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The type of person that the person involved is, e.g. Teacher, Peers, etc.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
The unique identifier allocated to every student in New Zealand, also known as the NSN.
Lists phone numbers associated with a person (StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal or StudentContactPersonal)
A person's home number.
A person's work number.
A person's mobile number.
This element represents a phone number and occurs within objects such as StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal, etc.
Notes on when / how to use the communication channel. eg: Phone after 4pm. Schools may also use this note to record caregiver related contact details, eg “Mon to Wed only”.
Preference number indicating an order in which communication channels should be used when contacting person or organisation.
A code describing the acceptable usage of a person or organisation's communication channel
Phone number. Free-form, but typical New Zealand formats include:
Phone number extension.
List to contain information of any plans that may eventuate.
Repeatable plan information.
A list of the possible motivations that triggered the event.
The possible motivation that triggered the event.
List of references to potential destination school for the departing student.
A reference to a potential destination school for the departing student.
Details around why a pre-enrolment for a school was canceled.
The date the school was notified of the pre-enrolment cancellation.
How the student's pre-enrolment was cancelled
The reason the pre-enrolment was cancelled.
Free text reason the pre-enrolment was canceled if the cancellation reason of other was selected.
A list of SIF data object references that form pre-requisites for the SchoolCourse, or AssessmentTask.
A repeatable element recording the identifiers and Name of the Prerequisite, which may be a LearningStandard, AssessmentTask, SchoolCourse or any other recognised SIF data object.
A staff member of the technology centre that authored the progress report.
Details of the reasons, and interventions leading up to the student's enrolment being terminated.
A code describing how or why the student's enrolment was terminated.
The post school activity the student is moving on to once they have exited the school.
A list of references to Wellbeing Event, Response & Appeal data objects, that record the process of terminating a students enrolment.
A list of the potential schools the student may go to after leaving this school.
List of awards and other types of recognition given to the student for this activity.
The nature of recognition given to the student for the successful completion of work in a co-curricular or extra-curricular activity.
Holds the audit for a records, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
The date and time the record being sent through was created in the source system.
The date and time the record was last updated.
The date and time the record was deleted.
The user that created the record in the source system.
The user that last updated the record.
The user that deleted the record.
The reason the record was deleted.
An object or element identifier, in GUID format
A list of the reflections the staff member performed.
A reflection that a staff member performed about the physical restraint incident.
A reflection that a staff member performed about the physical restraint incident.
Free text outlining the staff members thoughts on a type of reflection.
The type of reflection that the staff member performed.
A member of a list of related LearningStandard references.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
Code describing the relatiosnhip from a LearningStandard to a related LearningStandard.
A list of references to related LearningStandards
A member of the related LearningStandard list.
A list of an Organisation's related organisations
Extends ObjectReferenceType to add an extra element, OrganisationType, describing the nature of the related organisation.
The system defind UUID of the Organisation being referenced
The Ministry of Education Organisation Id of the Organisation being referenced
The normal descriptive name of the referenced organisation.
A reference to a Provider specific location at the Organisation; rather than the Provider as a whole.
The start date of the relationship between the two organisations.
The end date of the relationship between the two organisations.
The type of relationship the two organisations have with each other.
List of objects that this document relates to, e.g. a Wellbeing Response or Characteristic, Physical Restraint.
An object that this document relates to, e.g. a Wellbeing Response or Characteristic, Physical Restraint.
A Wellbeing Event gets created for every student involved in an event. This list links together all related Wellbeing Events.
Wellbeing Events that were created as the result of the same incident.
Code that defines the relationship of one person to another.
Code representing the relationship.
A free text description of relationship type, where Relationship To Student Type is set to ‘Other’, eg ‘Au-pair’, ‘Neighbour’.
A religious affiliation of an individual.
A list of the people who administered the physical restraint to the student.
The person who administered the physical restraint to the student.
The person who administered the physical restraint to the student.
The person who administered the physical restraint to the student.
Indicates whether or not the person involved has received training of the safe use of physical restraint.
Free text providing additional information about any training the person has had on the safe use pf physical restraint.
The role of the person who administered the physical restraint to the student.
A list of the debriefings that took place after the physical restraint incident occurred.
A debriefing that took place after the physical restraint incident occurred. A debriefing can be with a staff member or with the student and their parent/caregiver.
A debriefing that took place after the physical restraint incident occurred. A debriefing can be with a staff member or with the student and their parent/caregiver.
The date the debriefing about the use of physical restraint on the student occurred.
The time the debriefing about the use of physical restraint on the student occurred.
Free text outlining the findings of the debriefing in the use of physical restraint on the student.
Free text about the next steps and/or actions that will be taken in as a result of the debriefing on the use of physical restraint on the student.
Parent/caregiver comments made about the use physical restraint on the student.
Student comments made about the use physical restraint on the them.
The type of debriefing that occurred, e.g. staff, or student and parent/caregiver.
A list of the people that attended the debriefing.
A list of questions and their answers about the physical restraint incident.
A question and it's answer about the physical restraint incident that occurred. Additional free text information to support the answer may also be supplied.
A question and it's answer about the physical restraint incident that occurred. Additional free text information to support the answer may also be supplied.
The question asked about the physical restraint incident.
The answer to the question. Options are Yes or No.
A free text description providing additional information about the question if required.
A list of the people that witnessed the physical constraint.
A person that witnessed the physical restraint incident.

List of rooms in which the teaching or scheduled activity is held. Used for onsite venues which are represented in the source system as rooms. Can include large venues (ovals, library, etc), if they have been represented as rooms; source system practice varies.
The school's local identifier for the Room in which the teaching or scheduled activity is held.
Note: Does not refer to a Room SIF data object.
<font color="#4c4c4c">A list of generic references to a set of ScheduleAcademicDays</font>
An academic day that is to be applied to the schedule for the duration of this exception. If the list is present it must contain at least one entry.
<font color="#4c4c4c">A list of generic references to a set of Schedule Terms.</font>
The period time schedule to be applied to the school calendar for the duration of this exception. If the list is present it must contain at least one entry.
A list of the schedule terms that are relevant to this calendar date.
Defines details about a scheduled meeting. When scheduled meeting details are provided ad hoc meeting details cannot be provided.
The scheduled period this teaching group meeting attendance is being recorded for.
The time the scheduled meeting started.
The time the scheduled meeting finished.
A list of classifications given to the school.
A classification given to the school.
Describes the properties of the school service offered by the Provider.
A summary of the genders accepted by the school
A list of recognised policy choices adopted by the School.
Indicates whether or not the school has a student management system.
A list of classifications given to the school.
A list of SchoolYear elements describing the genders of students accepted for enrolment at each year level.
The name of the Technology Centre that is run as part of the school. eg: Marlborough Technology Centre is part of Bohally Intermediate School.
A list of SchoolYearLevel elements, describing the Year Levels taught by the School, and the Co-Ed Status of each year level.
A descriptor for a particular Year Level offered by the school, including detail of the gender of students that are accepted for enrolment in this year level.
The year levels offered by the school. This is actual year level of the students not funding year level. May only contain values from 1 to 13 inclusive.
This is the unique identifier for the combination of School Year, Gender and Boarding received from FIRST.
There may be multiple sets of School Year, Gender and boarding for a school, each with their own identifier. A record must be created for each set.
For example:

{ "SchoolYearGenderID": 38277, "SchoolYear": 54002, "SchoolYearDesc": "Year 2", "Gender": 55002, "GenderDesc": "Both Girls and Boys", "Boarding": 56003, "BoardingDesc": "None" }, { "SchoolYearGenderID": 38278, "SchoolYear": 54003, "SchoolYearDesc": "Year 3", "Gender": 55002, "GenderDesc": "Both Girls and Boys", "Boarding": 56003, "BoardingDesc": "None" }
Which genders are accepted for enrolment in this Year Level?
Says if the school has boarding and if so, if it is for girls only, boys only or both.
A list of the student's social goals.
Information about a student's social goal.
The date the student achieved their social goal.
A description of the social goal the student wants to achieve.
The name of the social goal the student wants to achieve.
The date the student's social goal was recorded.
A list of the special assessment conditions that a student is entitled to have when sitting an assessment.
A Special Assessment Condition that is a member of the related SpecialAssessmentConditionList.
A list of the staff involved and their role in relation to the assessment task, e.g. the staff member that created the assessment task, the moderator, the marker, the invigilator.
The staff member involved with the assessment task and their role, e.g. created the assessment task, moderator, marker.
The staff member involved with the assessment task and their role, e.g. created the assessment task, moderator, marker.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
The role of the staff member in realtion to the assessment task, e.g. assessment task creator or moderator.
The individual staff member as a member of the StaffList and their role.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
Code describing the staff member's role. Note: This role may affect the Teacher's access to the students' data for those students who are members of the TeachingGroup.
A list of associated staff members.
The individual staff member as a member of the StaffList and their role.
Extension of BasePersonInfoType for just the fields used by StaffPersonal
The name of the person.
The person's e-mail address(es).
A list of the reflections made by the staff members who applied the physical restraint.
The reflections performed by the staff member who applied the physical restraint to the student.
The reflections performed by the staff member who applied the physical restraint to the student.
A list of the reflections the staff member performed.
The date the staff member performed their reflection on the use of physical restraint on the student.
The staff member that witnessed the person who applied the restraint performing the staff reflections.
The staff member who performed the staff reflection.
Subject(s) Staff member is eligible to teach.
This element contains Staff subjects they are eligible to teach together with the teaching preference.
This element contains Staff subjects they are eligible to teach together with the teaching preference.
Priority of Subject to Teach.
NZ education standardised code denoting SubjectArea / LearningArea

Staff assignment to this particular subject area / learning area applies only for students enrolled in a particular set of year levels. e.g. "Asst. Head of Dept (Maths, Jnr)" could ony be responsible for Students in year levels 9 & 10, who are learning Mathematics.
A start date, which includes an implied 00:00:00.000 if it was expressed as a date-time

A list of Statistical Areas used to assign spatial areas to a location in New Zealand. It may contain exactly one StatisticalArea for each of the following spatial unit types: - Area Unit - General Electoral District - Community Board - Māori Electoral District - Mesh Block - Regional Council - Territorial Authority - Urban Area - Ward
A statistical area as described by a spatial unit type. For example, Auckland Central is a statistical area of spatial unit type General Electorate.
A particular statistical area defined by Statistics New Zealand. For example, Auckland Central is a statistical area of spatial unit type General Electorate.

Denotes the type of Spatial Unit that the StatisticalArea code refers to. Must be one of: - Area Unit - General Electoral District - Community Board - Māori Electoral District - Mesh Block - Regional Council - Territorial Authority - Urban Area - Ward
A valid value defined for the nominated spatial unit type, as defined by Statistics New Zealand in one of the definitions per NZCodeSetsSpatialUnitType.
A record of the Student's progress in a set of achievement objectives from the from the Technology curriculum strand, that was covered in the class.
A record of the Student's progress in a particular achievement objective from the Technology curriculum strand, that was covered in the class.
A record of the Student's progress in a particular achievement objective from the Technology curriculum strand, that was covered in the class.
Code denoting the particular achievement objective against which the student's progress is being reported.
The technology curriculum level that the student's progress report is being made against for this learning strand achievement objective. e.g. 2, 3, 4 or 5.
Code denoting the level of progress the student has made against the particular learning strand achievement objective. e.g. Beginner, Proficient, and Advanced.
A description of what the achievement objective covers.
A note about the student's overall effort in relation to this achievement objective for this strand.
A description of practical ability covered by the achievement objective for the strand.
A note about the student's practical ability progress in relation to this achievement objective for this strand.
Documents that relate to students progress in this strand achievement objective, e.g. report, photos, media, documents etc.
A list of the students that attended the teaching group meeting and their recorded attendance.
A student that attended the teaching group meeting and their recorded attendance.
A student that attended the teaching group meeting and their recorded attendance.
A student that attended the teaching group meeting and their recorded attendance.
The student's type of attednance at this teaching group meeting, e.g. present, absent or another reason for the stduent's non-attendance at school, or class.
The attendance code groups the student's attendance fell under, e.g. Present, Justified and Unjustified.
Free text note about the student's attendance.
The time the student arrived at the teaching group meeting. Only recorded if the student arrives after the meeting start time.
The time the student left the teaching group meeting. Only recorded if they stayed later than the meeting end time.
A list of student consent information.
Information about a piece of consent given, or a piece of consent not given.
Extension of BasePersonInfoType for just the fields used by StudentContactPersonal
The name of the person.
The person's e-mail address(es).
The person's address(es) - one or more addresses.
The person's phone number(s) - one or more phone numbers.
The person's household/s contact information. A list of one or more household’s contact information.
List of Student Course Choices that can be made, or have been made by a Student.
An individual Course choice that can be made, or has been made by a Student.
An individual Course choice that can be made, or as been made by a Student.
The student's preference for this subject, with respect to the other subject choices in the list.
The Course the student has chosen to study during the year.
Defines information related to a student's enrollment at an Early Childhood Education flavour of Provider.
The year level of the student enrolled in early childhood education.
Code denoting which part of the National Curriculum (NZ Curriculum or Te Marautanga o Aotearoa) the ECE learner is enrolled in.
A list of the student's interests.
Information about a student's interest.
Information about a student's interest.
The date the student's interest was recorded.
A description of the student's interest.
The name of the student's interest.
The type of interest, e.g. sports, arts, cultural.
If the student's interest is academic this holds the subject area they like.
A list of references to the set of Students who are assigned to the Teaching Group, SchoolCourse or AssessmentTask.
Generic reference to a Student in the list
A reference to a StudentPersonal data object, which may be by NationalStudentNumber, rather than StudentPersonal RefId or LocalId

The current year level of the student, at the time the associated record was created. Valid values are 0 to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The normal descriptive name of the referenced object.
The unique identifier allocated to every student in New Zealand, also known as the NSN.
Info collected about people.
The name of the person.
The person's e-mail address(es).
Previous, alternate or other names or aliases associated with the person.
The verified name of the person.
Demographic information about the person.
The person's address(es).
The person's phone number(s).
The person's household/s contact information.
A photo of the person. A person photo is stored in Document against the student with a document type of Person Photo.
A list of a persons known medical needs.
The identity of the other school were the student is concurrently enrolled.
The other school where the student is concurrently enrolled.
The type of CoEnrolment.
Free text confidential note made by the Client School in relation to the student.
Free text confidential note made by the parents/caregivers of the student.
Defines information related to a student's enrolment at a school education Provider for a particular academic year.

School calendar year for which this enrolment is applicable. May be either a single year or across multiple years e.g. schools using the Maramataka calendar start the school year in June or July thus the school year would be 2021-2022.
The first attendance date of the student at the school for the specified school year.
The date of the student's final attendance at the school in the school year.
The type of enrolment as it relates to this school, eg whether base school, co-enrolment.

Represents the year level at which the student is considered to be predominantly taught. For example – Year 10, Year 11. Can only contain the values 0 through to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
The criteria used to determine the eligibility status of a student for enrolment and MoE funding purposes.
Records how the Student's eligibility to enrol / for funding was verified by the school staff during the enrolment process.
Full-time equivalent numeric value of the student's course load during this Enrolment, expressed in decimal form, where 1.00 represents a full-time Enrolment.
The student classification for MoE funding purposes
Indicates the number of years for which funding has been provided by MoE. Must only contain values from 0 through to 15 inclusive.
Code denoting which half of the National Curriculum (NZ Curriculum or Te Marautanga o Aotearoa) the student is enrolled in.
The level of the National Curriculum (1-5) is the student enrolling in.
A list of languages, and the number of hours per week the Learner is taught in that language during the enrolment.
The number of years the student has been in immersion.
Indicates whether or not the student is under Section 9 agreement.
NZQA details for a student for this school year.
Indicates the level of ORS funding the student receives.

Student's choice of subject or learning areas to be studied during the school year. Not to be confused with StudentCourseChoiceList which records student's choices of specific courses to be studied during the year.

Student’s choice of courses to be studied during the school year. Not to be confused with StudentSubjectChoiceList which records student's choices of general subject and learning areas to be studied during the year.
Describes the student's enrolment with their base school in the case where this enrolment is not a base school enrolment.
Additional information collected for international enrolments.
A list of student consent information.
A list of references to StudentVoice entries recording the Student's academic attainment goals at the time of enrolment. e.g. they wish to achieve a certain qualification.
Details around why a pre-enrolment for a school was canceled.
List of Student Subject Choices where available.
Subjects Students Choose
Subjects Students Choose
Subject Priority
Code denoting the actual chosen subject or learning area.
A list of the student's or their whānau's voice in regards to the student 's interests, goals, and voice (comments, opinions).
The student's or their whānau's voice about their wellbeing characteristic in regards to the student 's interests, goals, and voice (comments, opinions).
A list of associated subject areas.
NCEA subject matter of a student's study. Used for Secondary Assessments (Year 11-12).
Subject matter of a student's study. Used for Primary Assessments (Year 1-10).
Additional information for an external response.
The response provider.
Additional information about a provider.
The status of the external response.
The MoE specialist service that has been selected as a response to a student's support need. Required if Response Detail = 'MOE' (MOE Specialists).
Who the response was funded by.
Additional detail about a funder.
The date the request about funding was made.
The status of the funding being provided for the response.
The reason funding was declined.
Additional information for an internal response.
The response provider.
The name of the person providing the response. Mandatory to be provided when the ProvidedBy = 'Teacher'.
The status of the internal response.
Who is funding the reponse.
A list of learning support needs that have been identified for the student.
A learning support need that has been identified for the student.
A list of responses made about a learning support need.
A responses made for a learning support need.
A list of the reviews made about the response.
A review of the response.
A review of a support need response.
The staff member reviewed the response.
The date of the review.
Free text comment about the review.
The date of the next review.
A list of attachments related to a learning support need response review.
A learning support need that has been identified for the student.
A learning support need that has been identified for the student. Links to WellbeingCharacteristic.
A list of responses made about a learning support need.
Container for details of a Removal/Suspension.

Categorisation of a Suspension record to fall into, In School, Withdrawal, and Expulsion/Exclusion etc. In School is usually NOT formally recognised by a jurisdiction but managed at a school level where the student is temporarily withdrawn from normal classes. Expulsion/Exclusion may mean the student’s attendance at a school is terminated.
A list of the Withdrawal Times that are included in this Wellbeing Response.
The duration of a Suspension in days 0.00 – X.xx. (Half Day = 0.5, Full Day = 1.0 or the percentage of any day.) Must be provided for a Suspension when known.
The date parent/carers were officially notified.
The date and time at which a meeting with the student’s parents/carers was held to resolve the Suspension.
Comments about how the Suspension has been resolved, including any reparative actions the student needs to take.
The date at which the student was permitted to return to school earlier than the agreed duration would have allowed.
Contains information specific to Te Rito, e.g. which functionality in Te Rito an organisation (school, ECE etc.) is utilising.
Indicates whether or not the organisation has access to the data analysis dashboards within the Te Rito platform.
Indicates which features of the Te Rito platform the organisation has access to the sLSR within the Te Rito platform.
Indicates whether or not the organisation has access to the VLE functionality within the Te Rito platform.
A list of records of the Student's progress in particular classes from the Technology curriculum. e.g. Hard Materials, Food Technology, Digital Design etc.
A record of the Student's progress in a particular class from the Technology curriculum.
A record of the Student's progress in a particular class from the Technology curriculum.
A technology centre class the progress report covers.
The staff member that taught the subject and assessed the student against the technology strand objectives.
Overall comment about the behaviour of the student over the course of the lessons in the Class.
Overall comment about the effort the student made within the Class.
A record of the Student's progress in a set of learning strands from the Technology curriculum, that were covered in the class.
Describes the properties of the tertiary education service offered by the Provider.
Code denoting the kind of Tertiary service. eg: University, Wananga, etc.
A record of how information about a person has been verified. For example, verification of name, date of birth, citizenship.
Code denoting the source of the person's identity or eligibility verificaiton.
The serial number of the identity document that was used to verify identity / eligibility
The date from which the identity document that was used to verify identity / eligibility is expired.
If true then verification has been confirmed by MoE
The date and time the identity verification even took place.
The provider, e.g. school, that provided the verification.
An extension of BaseName that includes the VerificationEvent details that record how the name was verified as a valid name for the person.

A title or prefix associated with the name. If any of: Mr, Mrs, Ms, Miss, Rev, Fr, Dr, Prof, Hon, Sir, Lord, Lady - these must be as shown, otherwise free text. Note that title is not applicable to learners.

Family name. That part of the person's name which is used to describe family, clan, tribal group, or marital association. Note that this element is required when known. However, it may not be possible to know the family name in which case you should add the available information to the FullName element.

Given name of the person. Note that this element is required if known. However, it may not be possible to know the given name in which case you should add the available information to the FullName element.

Middle names can be sent altogether in one element or if the source system has more than one middle name field across two elements. MiddleName with either contain all other given or middle names, each separated with a single space character, or it will hold the person's first middle name and SecondMiddleName will hold the other.

Middle names can be sent altogether in one element or if the source system has more than one middle name field, they can be spread across two elements. SecondMiddleName will either contain no values, or it will hold the person's second and subsequent middle names while MiddleName will hold the person's first middle name.
An indicator used to identify the naming conventions used by some predominantly non-European, ethnic or language groups and related to the display nature of a name.
The family name preferred most by the person (as written).
An indicator used to identify the naming conventions used by some predominantly non-European, ethnic or language groups and related to the display nature of a name.
The given name preferred most by the person (as written).
Textual suffix like PHD, JP, BSc.

A free text field for the complete name for display purposes. If this is associated with a StudentPersonal, StaffPersonal or StudentContactPersonal record and the FamilyName and GivenName are not both specified, then this becomes mandatory.
Code denoting how the name provided is used, e.g. birth name, preferred name, also known as (alias) etc.
Flag denoting that this name has been verified. Note: actual verification details are held in NameVerification sub-object.
The verification event that verified this name for the person (and perhaps the date of birth).
A list of any Wellbeing Alerts that have arisen as a result of this Characteristic.
A repeatable element recording the identifier and details of a Wellbeing Alert that arose as a result of the Wellbeing Characteristic.
A list of any appeals that are of interest to a Wellbeing Event, Response or Alert.
An appeal that is of interest to a Wellbeing Event, Response or Alert.
A list of the Wellbeing Characteristics that contributed to the creation of this Wellbeing Alert.
A repeatable element recording the identifier and details of a Wellbeing Characteristic.
List of Categories of the Wellbeing Event.
The category of the Wellbeing Event.
The category of the Wellbeing Event.
The category of the Wellbeing Event.
List of Sub-Categories associated with the Wellbeing Event's Category.
A list of any Wellbeing Events that have arisen as a result of this Characteristic.
A repeatable element recording the identifier and details of a Wellbeing Event that arose as a result of the Wellbeing Characteristic.
List of Sub-Categories associated with the Wellbeing Event's Category.
The sub-category of the Wellbeing Event.
The sub-category of the Wellbeing Event.
The sub-category of the Wellbeing Event.
Repeatable Plan information.
Any notes that can be provided regarding the need that led to the plan.
The Personalised Plan Document created as a response to a wellbeing event.
A list of the Wellbeing Responses that contributed to the creation of this Wellbeing Alert.
A repeatable element recording the identifier and details of a Wellbeing Response.
Where a student is to be removed or withdrawn partially for particular times in a week within the Start and End dates of the Response.
A repeatable withdrawal that was made as part of this Wellbeing Response.
Repeatable Withdrawal.
The start date of the withdrawal.
The end date of the withdrawal.
The school term the withdrawal took place in.
Object reference to one of: ScheduledActivity, SchedulePeriod, etc.

A list of valid year levels for a particular operation. Valid values are 0 to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
